items.summary: An overnight police chase across multiple suburbs has ended with the arrest of three teenagers after an alleged aggravated carjacking in Melbourne's south-east.

items.title: Taiwan's cunning tax compliance makes most shopping receipts a ticket in a lottery
items.summary: Most shopping receipts in Taiwan are also tickets for a lottery run every second month by the government to increase tax compliance, and there are some big prizes up for grabs.

items.title: Man charged with assaulting Labor identity Tim Picton granted bail in Perth court
items.summary: A 20-year-old man is granted bail after allegedly assaulting Tim Picton, a prominent Labor Party identity — an attack police prosecutors say may leave him permanently disabled, if he survives.

items.title: MCG curator Matt Page admits Boxing Day Test pitch 'favoured the bowlers too much'
items.summary: MCC boss Stuart Fox staunchly defends chief curator Matt Page after a wild Boxing Day Test finishes within two days.

items.title: 'Grumpy' seal disrupts Blairgowrie boat race on Victoria's Mornington Peninsula
items.summary: A wild seal dubbed "Grumpy" causes some commotion at an annual boat race on the Mornington Peninsula, outside Melbourne.

items.title: Veteran train driver calls time on 70-year career that 'will never happen again'
items.summary: Peter Sawtell remembers making friends and enemies, keeping fit behind a diesel engine, and even meeting King Charles III during his "legendary" career.

items.title: From soapboxes to social media: Two artists shaping Queensland's bush art scene
items.summary: Marion Moore is 101. Zarabella Bambling is 23. Despite their differences, both women have just celebrated the same major achievement as bush artists.

items.title: Police investigate death of woman in Port Macquarie
items.summary: A crime scene has been established after a woman died from unexplained injuries in New South Wales.

items.title: Hands-on memories spark connection for dementia residents at western NSW aged care home
items.summary: Creating meaningful, sensory activities for people living with dementia can be challenging, particularly when many traditional options feel more suited to children than adults with a lifetime of lived experience behind them.

items.title: A rescued dingo puppy explores its new surroundings.
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Dingo management should be 'non-lethal', traditional owners say
items.summary: When Sonya sees a black-and-tan dingo, she feels a connection to family and Country, but many landholders see them as livestock-killing pests. Can graziers and dingoes co-exist?

items.title: Mentors gave me confidence to navigate life with a disability. Now I'm giving back
items.summary: Other people with lived experience of blindness gave ABC reporter Nas Campanella the confidence to navigate life. Her mentee, Lily, is enjoying similar benefits.

items.title: What was on summer reading lists 100 years ago, in 1925?
items.summary: There are books from authors that would become household names — F. Scott Fitzgerald and A.A Milne among them — and books that are now banned in some countries. But what can we learn from what people were reading in 1925?

items.title: Man charged with two counts of murder after stabbing at Quakers Hill in Sydney
items.summary: Emergency services were called to a Quakers Hill home just before 5am after reports of a disturbance to discover a woman dead and a man fatally wounded.

items.title: Experts say climate change bigger threat to biodiversity than renewable energy projects
items.summary: As the green energy boom gathers pace, experts say climate change is a bigger threat to biodiversity than wind farms and other renewables projects.

items.title: Brisbane Heat beats Adelaide Strikers by seven runs, thanks to debutant Tom Balkin
items.summary: Injury to Shaheen Afridi leaves debutant Tom Balkin to bowl the final over, and the 21-year-old delivers to help Brisbane Heat to a seven-run BBL win over Adelaide Strikers.

items.title: How the teen social media ban is impacting Australia’s multicultural communities
items.summary: Sydney teenager Ilia Kyrychenko was relieved to delete his accounts after the social media ban, but the change is making it more difficult to connect with his loved ones in Ukraine.

items.title: Cyber attacks that occurred this year and how you can protect your data
items.summary: More than 500 data breaches were reported in Australia over the first half of 2025 alone, but there are some ways you can minimise your risk of being caught up in one.

items.title: Farm life is charming international visitors in Australia's outback
items.summary: The far west of New South Wales is playing host to a number of international visitors who are falling in love with outback farm life.

items.title: Parents in China use AI technology to monitor children's homework
items.summary: AI is becoming a regular presence at homework time in many Chinese households. Experts say where families draw the line matters more than the technology itself.

items.title: Steroid use is 'exploding' — but there are no clinical guidelines on how to quit
items.summary: A rising number of Australians are using steroids. But one expert says a lack of knowledge and widespread stigma make it tough to get clinical support.

items.title: Hard Quiz tournament: Think you are good at quizzes? I dare you to try these 50 questions
items.summary: Looking to settle who is the smartest in your family? Challenge them to a Hard Quiz tournament: five rounds, 50 questions.

items.title: Today in History: Top-secret Manhattan Project quietly approved
items.summary: On December 28, 1942, a US president formally approved an investment in the top-secret project to create nuclear weapons.

items.title: Three charged after fatal Christmas Eve stabbing in Perth suburb of Aubin Grove
items.summary: Three males are charged over the fatal stabbing of a 19-year-old in the Perth southern suburb of Aubin Grove on Christmas Eve.

items.title: Australia belted, England vindicated and Test cricket wounded in MCG Ashes Test farce
items.summary: As England deservedly celebrates a long-awaited Test win in Australia, everyone else involved counts the cost of a farcical and damaging two-day disaster at the MCG.

items.title: Hobart family reunited with dog nearly four years after it disappeared from home
items.summary: A blurry photo on social media has led to a Hobart family reuniting with their missing dog nearly four years after it vanished from their home.

items.title: Police overseeing Bondi terror response investigate tattooed man at Newcastle beach
items.summary: Police overseeing the response to the Bondi terror attack are investigating after a man was seen at a NSW beach allegedly showing a tattoo of a banned Nazi symbol.

items.title: Urban water restrictions likely across Victoria as dam levels drop and dry summer predicted
items.summary: Victoria's water storage levels have dropped to 61 per cent capacity after most of the state recorded below average rainfall in 2025.

items.title: How a tsunami in Sri Lanka sparked a push to prevent drowning
items.summary: What began as tsunami relief, has become something more powerful — teaching children not to fear the water that surrounds them.

items.title: Australians are drinking less, but one cohort won't give up the booze
items.summary: Health-conscious Australians may be thinking twice about having that first or second beer, but not all of us are getting the message when it comes to alcohol and risky drinking.

items.title: Storm Hunter returns for the Australian summer targeting a top doubles ranking
items.summary: Popular Australian Storm Hunter is back from injury and adamant she can return to the form that made her the world's top-ranked doubles player.

items.title: Trio of retirees from Dongara win award for community rubbish collection
items.summary: Armed with gloves, bags, buckets and tongs, a trio of passionate rubbish removalists have picked up an award in this regional Western Australia town.

items.title: 175-year-old Nor' West Bend Station reopened to public after decades of restoration work
items.summary: History is being brought back to life at a former pastoral station that has seen drought, boom and bust over the course of its 175 years.

items.title: Northern parts of Queensland bracing for heavy rainfall, potential flooding
items.summary: Holiday travellers are being urged to check road closures before setting off on their journey, with parts of the state expecting rain into the middle of next week.

items.title: Man charged with string of offences after burglaries that began on Christmas Day

items.title: Ladybirds set loose at Australian Parliament House in Canberra over summer to take out pests

items.title: 13 long reads to catch up on for your summer holiday
items.summary: Here we've gathered a bunch of other things to read while you're relaxing over summer.

items.title: Australian medical history – the heart donor who still walks the earth 20 years later
items.summary: Lucinda is a member of an exclusive club — living heart donors, and is the only woman to have a baby after a heart-lung-liver transplant

items.title: South Australian playwright pays tribute to late partner in new production
items.summary: An upcoming South Australian playwright was writing a horror, comedy show about the prospect of losing a much older partner, then it happened to him.

items.title: The best vantage points and everything else you need to know about Sydney's New Year's Eve fireworks
items.summary: Sydney's New Year's Eve celebrations will this year pay tribute to the victims of the Bondi terror attack, with events to feature a heavy police presence. Here is everything you need to know to plan your night.

items.title: BBL title-holders Hobart Hurricanes beat Perth Scorchers but lose Tim David to hamstring injury
items.summary: Hobart's title defence suffers a huge blow after star batter Tim David injures his hamstring in his team's four-wicket win over the Scorchers.

items.title: When green energy threatens what it is meant to save

items.title: Aboriginal community tension in Victoria's north amid health board division

items.title: A quick guide to the best fabrics and fibres for summer and their sustainability
items.summary: What our clothes are made of can make a big difference when it comes to keeping cool, but not all fabrics are created equal. Here is what to look for — and avoid — during the warmer months.

items.title: At least 14 injured in a knife and chemical attack at factory in Japan

items.title: Australia's batting headaches masked again by dismal English failure on wild Ashes Boxing Day
items.summary: Australia's batting order is unsettled, unbalanced and out of form, but it matters little as England throws in the towel and considers the challenge of a Boxing Day Ashes Test all too hard.

items.title: The best documentaries to binge in the weird week after Christmas
